title: 1, 3, 1+3, 13, what's next?
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let a and b be two constants such that ax + by = 1, a"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"+ b"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" =3, a"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + b"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 4, a"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + b"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 13 and a"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + b"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = m/n where m and n are coprime positive integers. What is m+n?"}]}]}

title: Alternating prime tower
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\Large 13^{17^{13^{17}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the last 3 digits of the number given above."}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I didn't know about Carmichael's lambda function. Had to work with the tools I had. :)

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yup this works!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that we can simplify the arithmetic greatly if we use "},{"type":"text","text":"Carmichael's lambda function","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" in favor of "},{"type":"text","text":"Euler's totient function","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" (as shown by Alan).

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Solve my problem: Alternating Palindrome Tower, to get another such interesting result.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            What's more interesting to note is that we can generalize this to:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"blockquote","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"q_1 = 13^{17} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Large q_{n+1} = 13^{17^{q_n}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=1,2,\ldots "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then the last 3 digits of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"q_2, q_3, q_4, \ldots "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are all 333.
"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 131st Problem 2016
